title: Xiaomi Redmi 4A is the company's most affordable smartphone in India, yours for Rs 5,999
text:
Xiaomi Redmi 4A is the company’s most affordable smartphone in India, yours... Xiaomi Redmi 4A is the company’s most affordable smartphone in India, yours for Rs 5,999 By - March 20, 2017 “The Redmi 4A features a 5-inch HD display, a Snapdragon 425 SoC, 13MP/5MP cameras and a 3,120mAh battery” 
After populating the sub-Rs 10,000 segment with its popular Redmi Note series smartphones, Xiaomi has launched its most affordable smartphone in India – the Redmi 4A . Xiaomi has also announced that the Redmi 4A is Made in India, along with 95 percent of its smartphones sold in the country. The Redmi 4A was originally unveiled in China last November. It brings VoLTE support, a matte metal finish design and an Infrared sensor on a budget. 
The Xiaomi Redmi 4A sports a 5-inch HD IPS display, and boots Android 6.0 Marshmallow-based MIUI 8. The phone is powered by a 1.4GHz quad-core Qualcomm Snapdragon 425 processor, mated to Adreno 308 graphics and 2GB of RAM. The storage capacity on board is 16GB, which is further expandable up to 128GB by inserting a microSD card. 
The Redmi 4A features a 13-megapixel rear snapper with phase detection autofocus, an LED flash, f/2.2 aperture and 1080p recording. The selfies are captured by a 5-megapixel front camera, which has an aperture of f/2.2 aperture. In terms of connectivity, it offers 4G, dual-SIM slots, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.1, and GPS with GLONASS. The device is fuelled by a generous 3,120mAh battery. 
Coming to the pricing and availability, the Xiaomi Redmi 4A has been priced at Rs 5,999, the same price it’s available for in China (RMB 599). It is being offered in dark grey, gold and a new rose gold hue. The phone’s dark grey and gold models will go on sale on Mi.com and Amazon India on March 23rd at 12pm. The rose gold variant will be available exclusively on Mi.com during Mi Fan Festival on April 6th. Facebook Comments
